TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant filed an action for damages with ORG . He claimed CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) from his neighbour on the ground that snow which had fallen from the roof of the latter ’s house had damaged his fence in DATE . The amount claimed was based on an expert ’s opinion of DATE elaborated at the applicant ’s request . In his action the applicant stated that , upon the municipal office ’s order of DATE , the neighbour had fixed the fence in a provisional manner . In the applicant ’s view , the repair had not been carried out properly . He therefore considered himself entitled to compensation .
On DATE the ORG heard CARDINAL witnesses .
On DATE the applicant challenged the judge . The ORG branch office of ORG dismissed the request on DATE .
On DATE the judge examined the damaged fence in the presence of the parties . Hearings before ORG were held on DATE and on DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed the action with reference to witness statements according to which the defendant had repaired the applicant ’s fence . The applicant appealed on DATE .
On CARDINAL DATE the ORG branch office of ORG adjourned the case as the applicant had challenged the presiding judge . On DATE ORG found that the judge concerned was not biased .
On DATE the ORG branch office of ORG quashed the first instance judgment and instructed ORG to appoint an expert with a view to determining the damage .
On DATE ORG adjourned the case pending the submission of an expert opinion .
On DATE the applicant challenged the ORG judge . On CARDINAL DATE the ORG branch office of ORG found that the applicant ’s request was unsubstantiated .

On DATE ORG appointed an expert and instructed him to assess the damage . On DATE the expert informed ORG that the applicant had not allowed him to inspect the property in question . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that he was obliged to co - operate with the expert .
On DATE the case was taken over by a different judge following the transfer of the judge who had originally dealt with it to a different court .
On DATE the expert informed ORG that the applicant had prevented him from entering his property . He was therefore not in a position to elaborate an opinion .

On DATE ORG asked the police to assist the expert . This request was revoked after the applicant had informed the court , on DATE , that he did not wish to be disturbed by third persons entering his property .

On DATE the expert appointed by ORG concluded in his opinion that the damage which the applicant had suffered amounted to SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL . The opinion was based on the material included in another expert opinion which had been elaborated at the applicant ’s request in DATE .

On DATE ORG delivered a decision on the expert ’s fees . The applicant appealed and contended that the appointment of the expert had been superfluous and that the opinion submitted by the expert appointed by the court was erroneous .

On DATE ORG delivered a judgment in which it ordered the defendant to pay compensation as claimed by the applicant , namely FAC . The compensation granted to the applicant was lower than the assessment made by the expert appointed by the court , as FAC was bound by the applicant ’s claim .

On DATE the applicant appealed . He claimed , with reference to the length of the proceedings , SKK CARDINAL in compensation for non - pecuniary damage . The applicant also claimed the reimbursement of the fees of the expert whom he had asked to assess the damage in DATE .
On DATE the defendant submitted his observations on the applicant ’s appeal .

On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal against the judgment of DATE . It noted that under the relevant provisions of ORG a plaintiff lacked standing to appeal against a first instance judgement by which his or her claim was allowed in full . In the same decision ORG upheld ORG decision on expert ’s fees of DATE .
